intro: Palicourea breedlovei, commonly known as the endemic species of the Caribbean, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. The plant produces small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, oval berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
